Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product listed on the TMLUZON website.

specifications.description: Technical specifications of the product (materials, dimensions, etc.).

imageUrl.description: URL of the high-resolution image showcasing the product.

CustomerReview.title: CustomerReview
CustomerReview.description: Represents a customer review for a product.

id.description: Unique identifier for the customer review.

rating.description: The rating given by the customer (e.g., 1-5 stars).

comment.description: The customer's comments about the product.

date.description: The date the review was submitted.

UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user of the application.

uid.description: Unique identifier for the user, from Firebase Auth.

email.description: The email address of the user.

CartItem.title: CartItem
CartItem.description: Represents an item added to the shopping cart.

id.description: Unique identifier for the cart item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the product in the cart.

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents an order placed by a customer.

orderDate.description: The date the order was placed.

totalAmount.description: The total amount of the order.

orderItems.description: A list of order item IDs associated with the order.

OrderItem.title: OrderItem
OrderItem.description: Represents an item in an order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the order item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the product in the order item.

price.description: The price of the product in the order item.

firestore.reasoning:
Based on the requirements, the data structure prioritizes a flat structure and path-based ownership for user-generated content (customer reviews, cart items, and orders) to ensure Authorization Independence. Product data is stored in a top-level collection accessible to all users but manageable only by admins.

The structure promotes Authorization Independence by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. Customer reviews, cart items, and orders are stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, inherently associating them with the user. This allows direct enforcement of ownership rules based on the request's `auth.uid` without needing to fetch parent documents. For the admin dashboard, a single document is used to manage the application's settings. Since only admins should have access, a document `/roles_admin/{uid}` will determine read/write privileges.

The structure supports QAPs by:

1.  **Products:** Secure `list` operations on products are possible because they are stored in a top-level collection, and admin privileges are checked via a separate `/roles_admin/{uid}` document.
2.  **User-Specific Data:** `list` operations on customer reviews, cart items, and orders are secured by the path-based ownership `/users/{userId}`, ensuring users can only access their own data.
3.  **Settings:** Only admin users have access to the settings.
